3.Pros: Really a great place to work. Working at corporate HQ has been great. I really enjoyed my job and all the people I work with.
3.Cons: I really just don't see that much room for growth at the company. It's very corporate and it's hard to get high up now.

4.Pros: It's an easy job for the most part, sometimes make good friends, a pretty flexible schedule. 50% off food during break as well
4.Cons: Managers are two-faced, they are also extremely under qualified, and way too much drama in the workplace. The restaurant needs to be updated badly also.

6.Pros: The food is free when one works, they have a good discount on days off and benefits are good if you move up on the list of importances
6.Cons: The stress of customers asking for things that they want for free the employees that like to call out because they have better things to do and it screw over the people that show up on time to work

7.Pros: McDonalds have pretty good benefits for their employees everything from G.E.D. assistance, rapid job growth for those who earn it, delicious food perks, etc
7.Cons: We must improve our customer service standards across the board, greatly improve the overall health/cleanliness of the back of the house. Make sure that every employee is fully trained and certified.

8.Pros: Flexible schedule and good pay. Learned a few things while I was here.
8.Cons: Didn't like the principal concept of the company. Felt guilty working here. I don't think it's good for the environment.

9.Summary: "My experience at McDonald's was an eye opener."
9.Pros: Some pros for this job would be that they Provided training for management. They also had a pool of diverse workers
9.Cons: Some negative effects I can say about working at McDonald's is that they asked for Big expectations with no motivational support, or raises!Not a professional environment/Favoritism
